creator: jheight@apache.org
text:
Upon a post the current mechanism to store the content body of the HTTP request 
stores the body as a set of url parameters. This leads to complications down 
track because all url parameters are URLEncoded. When the mime type is 
something other than application/x-www-form-urlencoded the message body should 
be stored in a seperate structure so it can be sent unimpeeded.

This is required (for instance) for applet-servlet xml communication, As such 
if I want to test the servlet resopnse the content needs to be stored as xml.

I have created some patch files that solves this problem. Note that the patches 
does not handle other content types other than text types properly (since the 
content body is stored as a string).
